NATIONAL NEWS






BRIEF: Duke Energy seeks OK for two plants



Jul. 4--CHARLOTTE -- Duke Energy has asked state regulators for permission to build two power plants in the state.  The Charlotte-based electric utility wants to add a power plant at the existing Buck Steam Station in Rowan County and another at the existing Dan River site in Rockingham County. Both plants would have an output capacity of 600 megawatts to 800 megawatts.


Jul 4, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Gas-bill programs on hold: PUC suspends fixed-price plans as attorney general investigates



Jul. 4--The Minnesota Public Utilities Commission voted Tuesday to suspend the "fixed price" billing programs that the state attorney general said overcharged thousands of CenterPoint Energy and Xcel Energy customers.  The fixed-price plans allowed customers to lock in a set price on their natural gas bills, but Minnesota Attorney General Lori Swanson said they confused many customers, who ...


Jul 4, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



OPPD considers a third coal plant



Jul. 4--The Omaha Public Power District is mulling a third coal plant at Nebraska City as the least expensive way of expanding electrical capacity in the decade ahead.  A second plant already is under construction on the utility's Nebraska City campus next to its current plant. With room for two more coal plants there, the district is studying whether a third should be built as soon as 2016, when ...


Jul 4, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Simple steps ease jump in BGE bills



Jul. 4--In preparation for his first electric bill after last month's 50 percent rate increase, Bolton Hill resident and landlord Greg Baranoski harked back to his childhood in the 1960s.  Despite an above-average number of 90-degree days last month, he turned on his air conditioning only twice. Instead, he slept under a ceiling fan and with the windows open.


Jul 4, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Fixed-price utility billing plans frozen



Jul. 4--The Public Utilities Commission on Tuesday put a freeze on controversial billing plans offered by CenterPoint Energy and Xcel Energy, shutting down both fixed-price programs for the 2007-2008 winter heating season while an investigation by the attorney general's office continues.  It remains to be seen whether the bulk of the 56,000 customers enrolled in the program, which allows ...


Jul 4, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Switch off: Coal-fired plant will not be built: Disney's energy grid would have benefited



Jul. 4--The plug has been pulled on a proposed coal-fired power plant that might have provided Walt Disney World with up to a quarter of its future electricity. The consortium that planned to build the 800-megawatt Taylor Energy Center in Taylor County in North Florida announced Tuesday that it was suspending its efforts and will join Gov. Charlie Crist's alternative-energy program.

Making energy policy an issue: O'Malley works to electrify conservation efforts in Maryland



Jul. 4--With two announcements in two days and more on the way, Gov. Martin O'Malley has elevated state energy policy to the top tier of his administration's priorities -- a move that could help him blunt political criticism over the electric rate increases he failed to stop.  With the 50 percent BGE rate increase that took effect June 1, the governor faces the possibility of a hot and cranky ...

Jul. 5--JOPLIN, Mo. -- A Joplin, Mo.-based power company has announced plans to purchase energy from a yet-to-be-built wind farm in Cloud County.  Empire District Electric Co. has signed a 20-year purchase power agreement with Cloud County Wind Farm LLC, which is owned by Houston-based Horizon Wind Energy. According to a news release last week, Horizon Wind Energy plans to start building the ...

Utilities propose settlement with wind developers



Jul. 4--Idaho's three large regulated electric utilities have proposed a settlement with wind developers that they say could resolve cost issues that have slowed development of small wind projects in Idaho.  Idaho Power had asked the Public Utilities Commission to place a moratorium on rapidly increasing wind development projects within its territory while the company studied how much it would ...


Jul 4, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Summer heat sizzles Southland



Jul. 4--Near-record-high temperatures are expected to put a strain on people and power lines through Thursday.  The National Weather Service forecasts a high of 112 today and 114 Thursday. Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger has ordered the opening of state cooling centers at fairgrounds in 13 counties, including the San Bernardino County Fairgrounds in Victorville. At St.


Jul 4, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Edison customers offered discount



Jul. 5--VICTORVILLE -- Southern California Edison is offering a discount plan that enables customers to receive credit on their summer energy bills. Depending on which plan they choose, customers can save up to $200 in exchange for permitting Edison to install a remote-controlled device in their central air conditioner. The device permits the energy company to turn off the air conditioner during ...

Record high expected Thursday in Sacramento



Jul. 5--Even a hint of humidity can make the weather feel warmer than it is. In Arizona, they say it's a "dry heat," as if that helps the onslaught of 110-degree days during the summer months in the desert.  But low humidity does bring some consolation with a record-high temperature of 106 expected in Sacramento on Thursday. This week's blast of heat is coming from a high-pressure zone over the ...

Energy assistance applications available in Madison County



Jul. 5--The Madison County Community Development Department will accept applications for energy assistance from July 9 to July 20 as part of its Summer Energy Assistance Program.  The program helps low-income households pay for electric services. It is funded by the U.S. Department of Healthcare and Family Services' Office of Energy Assistance. Eligible households include seniors, the disabled, ...

Duke Carolinas proposes gas-fired units



-- Duke Energy Carolinas wants to build a 600- to 800-MW gas-fired plant in Rockingham County that would begin producing power in 2011. The company also plans to expand an already-proposed gas plant in Rowan County, boosting it to as much as 800 MW from 600. The proposed gas units would be intermediate plants. In filings this week with N.C. regulators, Duke said it will seek state approval in the ...


Jul 5, 2007 Power Engineering



No blackouts expected if users careful



Electricity grid managers on Tuesday asked Californians to use less energy during this week's heat wave after problems in the southern part of the state pinched supplies. With temperatures expected to hit triple digits from Redding to Palm Springs, homeowners were asked to shut off unneeded lights, set thermostats no lower than 78 degrees and hold off using washing machines until night.

Tilting at windmills



The price tag is now at $697 million to build 40 massive turbines in the ocean off Jones Beach to provide only 140 megawatts of power, a fraction of what the area uses. Even though FPL Energy, the winning bidder for the project, would directly pay the construction costs, the company would recoup that money through the rates it charges the Long Island Power Authority.

Tucson Electric Power Co. formally filed a rate case Monday that would increase average electric rates by as much as 23 percent overall beginning in 2009 after a 10-year rate freeze.
